definition: thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: As for apprehension of Yoga, its sexual appeal well-worth exploring is beyond our common vision.
sentences.chinese: 基于瑜伽的理解，最耐人寻味的性感是超越视觉的。

sentences.english: Traceable among the rough marks of hatchet and chisel were delicate lines zigzagging .
sentences.chinese: 近看，耐人寻味，在粗犷的斧凿中行走着蜿蜒的线。

sentences.english: What she has said affords much food for thought.
"The Song of Life" follows the work of König in two projects.
sentences.chinese: 《生命之歌》纪录下了柯尼希的两个耐人寻味的项目。

sentences.english: Panxiangli tells us a thought-provoking story of feminie emotion.
sentences.chinese: 潘向黎为我们讲述了一个耐人寻味的女性情感故事。

sentences.english: Both catchy and intriguing, they surprise and titillate the imagination.
sentences.chinese: 上口和耐人寻味的，他们惊喜，撩拨的想象力。

sentences.english: Loki provides an intriguing setting for this pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 洛基为这种追求提供了一个耐人寻味的设置。

sentences.english: It also has a meaty discussion forum.
sentences.chinese: 网站上还有一个耐人寻味的论坛。

sentences.english: The essay seems to come in handy, but intriguing.
sentences.chinese: 这篇散文似乎信手拈来，但却耐人寻味。

sentences.english: One may begin perspiring at the very thought.
sentences.chinese: 在一个可以开始出汗颇耐人寻味。

definition: (idiom) thought-provoking/to give one food for thought
to have profound import (idiom); to be deeply significant
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
the implied message is deep (idiom); having deep implications
meaning/implication/flavor/overtone/to mean/to imply/(Tw) to get a sense of
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
